title: Chinese Consulate General in Cape Town donates food packets worth ZAR 8,000 to constituency heads of the South African Parliament in May 2020
description: In May 2020, the Chinese Consulate General in Cape Town donated food packets worth ZAR 8,000 to constituency heads of the South African Parliament. The constituency heads were to distribute the food to their most vulnerable constituents.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Consulate General in Cape Town donates food packets worth ZAR 8,000 to constituency heads of the South African Parliament in May 2020

# Description
In May 2020, the Chinese Consulate General in Cape Town donated food packets worth ZAR 8,000 to constituency heads of the South African Parliament. The constituency heads were to distribute the food to their most vulnerable constituents.
justification: Project is a humanitarian aid effort unrelated to energy or environmental impacts
evidence: Food donation to vulnerable constituents, no energy or environmental components

title: Longyuan power group donates ZAR 1.2 million in Covid-19 supplies to Cape Flats, South Africa in April 2020
description: On April 17, 2020, Longyuan and local Chinese communities in South Africa donated cash, food parcels, surgical masks, and other medical supplies worth ZAR 1.2 million to Cape Flats, an impoverished district of Cape Town.   The donations were received by Cape Town Executive Mayor Dan Plato at the Chinese Consulate in Cape Town.  This investment is part of Longyuan South Africa's goal to contribute ZAR 15 million each year to the community to promote the development of the local economy around its Mulilo De Aar Wind Power Project. Other projects that Longyuan has undertaken include those related to culture, education, medical and health care, skills training, and other public welfare undertakings in the community.
combined_text:

The donations were received by Cape Town Executive Mayor Dan Plato at the Chinese Consulate in Cape Town.  This investment is part of Longyuan South Africa's goal to contribute ZAR 15 million each year to the community to promote the development of the local economy around its Mulilo De Aar Wind Power Project. Other projects that Longyuan has undertaken include those related to culture, education, medical and health care, skills training, and other public welfare undertakings in the community.
justification: Project involves donation of medical supplies and food parcels for community welfare, unrelated to energy or environmental impacts
evidence: Donation of surgical masks, food parcels, and medical supplies worth ZAR 1.2 million for Covid-19 relief

title: China donates first batch of anti-epidemic supplies to South Africa (linked to project ID#93482)
description: In 2020, the Chinese government donated two batches of anti-epidemic supplies to the government of South Africa. The second donation was received on April 14, 2020 (see project ID#93482). Information about the first is less clear. The nature and arrival date of the supplies are unknown.

title: Chinese Embassy donates anti-epidemic materials to Ministry of National Defense of South Sudan in April 2020
description: On April 30, 2020, the Chinese Embassy donated anti-epidemic materials to the Ministry of National Defense of South Sudan. The specific type, amount and monetary value of this donation are unknown.  These supplies were handed over to South Sudan during the meeting between Hua Ning, the Chinese Ambassador to South Sudan, and South Sudan’s new Defense Minister, Angelina Jany Teny. The Ambassador and Defense Minister also discussed COVID-19 prevention efforts and cooperation between China and South Sudan.

evidence: Donation of anti-epidemic materials, focus on COVID-19 prevention efforts

title: Chinese Government provides $20 million grant for Phase 2 of Educational Technical Cooperation Project (Linked to Project ID#59201)
description: In March 2015, the Chinese Government and the Government of South Sudan agreed to conduct a feasibility study for the Educational Technical Cooperation Project. The feasibility study was completed in May 2015. Then, on February 3, 2016, the Chinese Government and the Government of South Sudan signed an exchange of letters regarding Phase 1 of the Educational Technical Cooperation Project. China’s Ministry of Commerce (MOFCOM) reportedly committed $6 million of grant funding for the project’s first phase (captured via Project ID#59201).   Phase 1 involved the design of courses, the training for over 200 South Sudanese teachers in China, the printing of over 1,299,000 textbooks for use by 150,000 teachers and students, and the construction of training centers. China South Publishing and Media Group (中南出版传媒集团股份有限公司) was the contractor responsible for project implementation. Phase 1 officially commenced on June 29, 2016. One month later, on July 29, 2016, MOFCOM awarded a contract to China South Publishing and Media Group. Then, on December 23, 2016, a project implementation agreement was signed by the Chinese Government and the Government of South Sudan. The first phase of teacher training activities was completed in April 2017. During Phase 1, 54 teachers were trained including 14 members of parliament who were members of the education committee. Then, on July 14, 2017, the first batch of 745,000 textbooks and the equipment of the ICT teacher training center arrived in Juba. The second batch of 554,000 textbooks was scheduled for printing by the end of 2017. The project’s first phase passed a mid-term inspection by MOFCOM in December 2017. A one-month ICT training was successfully completed in South Sudan in February 2018. The project’s ICT infrastructure and ICT training component was completed in September 2018. Phase 1 ultimately reached completion on November 22, 2018.   Then, on June 18, 2020, the Chinese Government and the Government of South Sudan signed an exchange of letters regarding Phase 2 of the Educational Technical Cooperation Project. MOFCOM reportedly committed $20 million of grant funding for the project’s second phase (captured via Project ID#92527). Phase 2 involves the compilation and printing of primary school textbooks for the subjects of English, Mathematics and Science, the capacity building of teachers and educational management personnel. It also involves the development and supply of textbook usage evaluation systems, and supply of teaching equipment and the carrying out of Chinese language programs. Shanghai Educational Publishing House, a leading educational press in China, is the contractor responsible for project implementation. Project implementation officially commenced on December 6, 2021.  Then, in February 2022, South Sudan's Ministry of Education in partnership with the Chinese Embassy in South Sudan officially launched a Chinese Language training center at the Juba Day Secondary School in Juba.
staff_comments: This project is also known as the Phase 2 of the China-Aided Educational Technical Cooperation Project. The Chinese project title is 中国援南苏丹教育技术二期项目.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
Chinese Government provides $20 million grant for Phase 2 of Educational Technical Cooperation Project (Linked to Project ID#59201)

# Description
In March 2015, the Chinese Government and the Government of South Sudan agreed to conduct a feasibility study for the Educational Technical Cooperation Project. The feasibility study was completed in May 2015. Then, on February 3, 2016, the Chinese Government and the Government of South Sudan signed an exchange of letters regarding Phase 1 of the Educational Technical Cooperation Project. China’s Ministry of Commerce (MOFCOM) reportedly committed $6 million of grant funding for the project’s first phase (captured via Project ID#59201).   Phase 1 involved the design of courses, the training for over 200 South Sudanese teachers in China, the printing of over 1,299,000 textbooks for use by 150,000 teachers and students, and the construction of training centers. China South Publishing and Media Group (中南出版传媒集团股份有限公司) was the contractor responsible for project implementation. Phase 1 officially commenced on June 29, 2016. One month later, on July 29, 2016, MOFCOM awarded a contract to China South Publishing and Media Group. Then, on December 23, 2016, a project implementation agreement was signed by the Chinese Government and the Government of South Sudan. The first phase of teacher training activities was completed in April 2017. During Phase 1, 54 teachers were trained including 14 members of parliament who were members of the education committee. Then, on July 14, 2017, the first batch of 745,000 textbooks and the equipment of the ICT teacher training center arrived in Juba. The second batch of 554,000 textbooks was scheduled for printing by the end of 2017. The project’s first phase passed a mid-term inspection by MOFCOM in December 2017. A one-month ICT training was successfully completed in South Sudan in February 2018. The project’s ICT infrastructure and ICT training component was completed in September 2018. Phase 1 ultimately reached completion on November 22, 2018.   Then, on June 18, 2020, the Chinese Government and the Government of South Sudan signed an exchange of letters regarding Phase 2 of the Educational Technical Cooperation Project. MOFCOM reportedly committed $20 million of grant funding for the project’s second phase (captured via Project ID#92527). Phase 2 involves the compilation and printing of primary school textbooks for the subjects of English, Mathematics and Science, the capacity building of teachers and educational management personnel. It also involves the development and supply of textbook usage evaluation systems, and supply of teaching equipment and the carrying out of Chinese language programs. Shanghai Educational Publishing House, a leading educational press in China, is the contractor responsible for project implementation. Project implementation officially commenced on December 6, 2021.  Then, in February 2022, South Sudan's Ministry of Education in partnership with the Chinese Embassy in South Sudan officially launched a Chinese Language training center at the Juba Day Secondary School in Juba.
justification: Project focuses on education and capacity building without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Educational technical cooperation, textbook production, teacher training, Chinese language programs

title: PetroChina donates anti-epidemic materials to the Ministry of Petroleum and Mining of South Sudan in June 2020
description: On June 23, 2020, PetroChina Company Limited, a Chinese oil and gas company, donated a batch of anti-epidemic materials to the Ministry of Petroleum and Mining of South Sudan. The total donation amounted to 112 boxes of medical supplies. The materials included 100,00 surgical masks, 5,000 N95 masks, and 100 thermometers. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation in Juba, the capital of South Sudan. China’s Ambassador to Sudan, Hua Ning, South Sudan's Deputy Minister of Petroleum and Mining, the Economic and Commercial Counselor of the Embassy, and the Deputy General Manager of PetroChina International attended the ceremony.
staff_comments: AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
PetroChina donates anti-epidemic materials to the Ministry of Petroleum and Mining of South Sudan in June 2020

# Description
On June 23, 2020, PetroChina Company Limited, a Chinese oil and gas company, donated a batch of anti-epidemic materials to the Ministry of Petroleum and Mining of South Sudan. The total donation amounted to 112 boxes of medical supplies. The materials included 100,00 surgical masks, 5,000 N95 masks, and 100 thermometers. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation in Juba, the capital of South Sudan. China’s Ambassador to Sudan, Hua Ning, South Sudan's Deputy Minister of Petroleum and Mining, the Economic and Commercial Counselor of the Embassy, and the Deputy General Manager of PetroChina International attended the ceremony.
justification: Project involves donation of medical supplies for public health purposes, unrelated to energy or environmental impacts
evidence: Donation of anti-epidemic materials including masks and thermometers, health sector focus

title: Chinese Embassy donates anti-epidemic supplies to the South Sudan Ministry of Health in July 2020
description: On July 17, 2020, the Chinese Embassy in South Sudan donated anti-epidemic supplies to the Ministry of Health in South Sudan. The supplies included 58 oxygen concentrators and 2,000 ventilator consumables. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation at the Juba Teaching Hospital in South Sudan. Chinese Ambassador to South Sudan, Hua Ning, and South Sudan's Deputy Minister of Health attended the ceremony and delivered speeches. The Economic and Commercial Counselor of the Embassy, Cai Senming, the Director of Juba Teaching Hospital, the captain of the 7th South Sudan medical team, Tang Youbin, and the South Sudanese Medical Team Leader of the Technical Cooperation Group also attended the ceremony.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

Chinese Ambassador to South Sudan, Hua Ning, and South Sudan's Deputy Minister of Health attended the ceremony and delivered speeches. The Economic and Commercial Counselor of the Embassy, Cai Senming, the Director of Juba Teaching Hospital, the captain of the 7th South Sudan medical team, Tang Youbin, and the South Sudanese Medical Team Leader of the Technical Cooperation Group also attended the ceremony.
justification: Project is focused on healthcare and epidemic response, with no direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Donation of anti-epidemic supplies including oxygen concentrators and ventilator consumables to Ministry of Health

title: China sends anti-epidemic medical team to South Sudan in August 2020
description: On August 19, 2020, an arrival ceremony was held to celebrate the arrival of a Chinese anti-epidemic medical team in South Sudan. The team consists of 8 medical and nursing experts and they will work in South Sudan for nine days. The team specializes in the fields of laboratory technology, infection, insensitive care, public health, and nursing. During their nine-day residency, the medical team will work with senior South Sudanese government officials, local health experts, medical institutions, and medical staff on COVID-19 prevention and response.   During the ceremony, the Chinese government also donated anti-epidemic supplies to South Sudan (Project ID#94236).   On August 27, 2020, the medical team finished their mission and held a work summary report meeting.
combined_text:

title: Chinese Embassy donates computer equipment to South Sudan in October 2020
description: On October 13, 2020, the Chinese Embassy in South Sudan donated computer equipment to the Government of South Sudan and the Intergovernmental Authority on Development (IGAD) Monitoring and Verification Mechanism Office for South Sudan. The Government of South Sudan and the IGAD Office in South Sudan had requested this donation of computers from the Chinese Embassy to help overcome the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic. The quantity and monetary value of this donation are unknown.   A handover ceremony took place for this donation. China’s Ambassador to South Sudan, Hua Ning, signed a handover certificate at the ceremony with the Minister of Cabinet Affairs of South Sudan and the Senior Advisor of the IGAD Office in South Sudan. Abu Dong, the Secretary-General of South Sudan, also attended the ceremony.
combined_text:
# Sector
COMMUNICATIONS

# Title
Chinese Embassy donates computer equipment to South Sudan in October 2020

# Description
On October 13, 2020, the Chinese Embassy in South Sudan donated computer equipment to the Government of South Sudan and the Intergovernmental Authority on Development (IGAD) Monitoring and Verification Mechanism Office for South Sudan. The Government of South Sudan and the IGAD Office in South Sudan had requested this donation of computers from the Chinese Embassy to help overcome the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic. The quantity and monetary value of this donation are unknown.   A handover ceremony took place for this donation. China’s Ambassador to South Sudan, Hua Ning, signed a handover certificate at the ceremony with the Minister of Cabinet Affairs of South Sudan and the Senior Advisor of the IGAD Office in South Sudan. Abu Dong, the Secretary-General of South Sudan, also attended the ceremony.
justification: Project involves donation of computer equipment for social development purposes, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of computer equipment to government and intergovernmental organization, aimed at overcoming COVID-19 pandemic impacts
